title.native: その着せ替え人形は恋をする
title.romaji: Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru

description:
High schooler Wakana Gojou cares about one thing: making Hina dolls. With nobody to share his obsession, he has trouble finding friends—or even holding conversation. But after the school’s most popular girl, Marin Kitagawa, reveals a secret of her own, he discovers a new purpose for his sewing skills. Together, they’ll make her cosplay dreams come true!

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: Sono Kisekae Ningyou wa Koi wo suru
หนุ่มเย็บผ้ากับสาวนักคอสเพลย์
その着せ替え人形（ビスク・ドール）は恋をする
Si Boneka Rias Sedang Jatuh Cinta

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

title.native: その着せ替え人形は恋をする
その着せ替え人形は恋をする Season 2

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kafunsyokougun)

Animation Producer at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Started his career at [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) as a production assistant on several series, already demonstrating his great penchant for scouting and fostering new talents. His first major role on an anime was as Production Desk on [Engaged to the Unidentified](https://anilist.co/anime/20483/) in 2014.

He left Doga Kobo in 2017 and joined [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/), later landing at CloverWorks after the studio became independent.

__[Website](https://spiraspica.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/spiraspica) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/spiraspica/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcrVKHnn9O3z0Ao6sUPE7nA)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
Spira Spica is a Japanese three-piece pop rock band under record labels Tower Records and Sacra Music (2018–), affiliated with the entertainment office Sony Music Artists.

__Biography:__
The band initially formed and began activities in 2013 under the name Snowman. Originally the band only consisted of childhood friends Yuuji and Masuda, but they were later joined by the vocalist Mikiha, who had initially heard of the band after they announced they were looking for a female vocalist.

On January 6, 2018, the band announced they would change their band name from Snowman to Spira Spica, which they have used since.

__Members:__
- [Mikiha](https://anilist.co/staff/169459) (幹葉) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics
- Yuuji Teranishi (寺西裕二) – guitarist
- Masuda (ますだ) – bassist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/990312056)

Originating from Studio Giants' in-between department, Studio Lions.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hiroki_Chura)

The current director of Chura Sound.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).
